main event: A bright oval-shaped object observed over Lexington, Kentucky on 1/22/1953 for 40 seconds by three individuals provided an intense reddish glow before fading out completely. The movement of the object was in the opposite direction of the wind at the time.
interesting points: The object was observed traveling at a slow rate of speed with a steady light and intense reddish glow.
The object stopped in the sky, slowly grew smaller, became vague in shape, then faded out completely over a period of 5 to 10 seconds.
The moon was not in the same direction or height as the object, and the movement of the object was almost the opposite of the wind direction at the time.
Various sightings of unidentified aerial phenomena (UAP) were reported in Lexington, Kentucky in February 1953 by both military and civilian observers.
The witnesses saw an oval-shaped object resembling the color of hot metal, and the object was also sketched with details provided about its shape and motion.
witnesses: three individuals, including Lt. Trainor and others (civilian)
